H0.text: Shivering in cold temperatures is a response of the autonomic nervous system that helps maintain equilibrium in the body.

H1.text: Eating due to appetite is a response of the autonomic nervous system that helps maintain equilibrium in the body.

H2.text: Slapping at biting insects is a response of the autonomic nervous system that helps maintain equilibrium in the body.

H3.text: Pulling away from hot objects is a response of the autonomic nervous system that helps maintain equilibrium in the body.

A4.text: When the core body temperature drops, the shivering reflex is triggered to maintain homeostasis.

A5.text: Shivering (also called shuddering) is a bodily function in response to cold and extreme fear in warm-blooded animals.
